lines.content: // Change this to your main class.
* The DeadLine class extends the Task Class. The DeadLine class is associated with Tasks that have a deadline.
* Hence, the LocalDateTime attribute of this class is derived from what comes after "/by" in the user's command

*

The Event class contains a LocalDateTime object
* Duke class represents a chatbot that keeps tracks of tasks.
* Three unique commands can be given to the chatbot: "todo", "event and "deadline"
* After each command, a description must be given.
* In the case of the "event" class, after the description, the timing and date must be given after inputting "/at".
* Date and timing must be given in this specific format (dd/mm/yyyy hhmm).
* The same applies to deadline, but changing the "/at" to "/by".
* Other function includes marking the task as done and removing it from the list.
* use "list" to printout the exising tasks on the list
System.out.println("Konnichiwa! I am Duke the cat! What can I do for you? meow~ (^.___.^)");
Parser parser = new Parser(storage, ui, taskList, sc);
/** constructor for DukeExcpetion. Takes in the error message as input.
str = "Sorry~ The description of a todo cannot be empty desu!! >:(";
str = "Sorry~ The description of a deadline cannot be empty desu!! >:(";
str = "Sorry~ The description of a event cannot be empty desu!! >:(";
str = "Sorry~ The task number is invalid!! >:(";
str = "Sorry~ I don't know what this means >.<";
str = "Sorry~ The task number is invalid!! >:(";
str = "Sorry~ There needs to be a timing!";
* The Event class extends the Task Class. The Event class is associated with Tasks that happens a specific timing.
* Hence, the LocalDateTime attribute of this class is derived from what comes after "/at" in the user's command

*

The Event class contains a LocalDateTime object
* The Parser class handles directly the user's command. After parsing the command, the Parser object will call the
* relevant methods in response to the command.

*

A Parser object has Storage, Ui, TaskList and Scanner objects as its attribute
* Constructor for the Parser class. Takes in Storage, Ui, TaskList and Scanner as its input.
* @param storage Storage object specific to this parser
* @param ui Ui object specific to this parser
* @param taskList TaskList object specific to this parser
* @param sc Scanner object specific to this parser
public Parser(Storage storage, Ui ui, TaskList taskList, Scanner sc) {
* This method makes sense of the user's command and calls the appropriate methods in response.
* @param command This is the user's command
public void parse(String command) throws DukeException, IOException {
* The Storage class handles the loading of tasks from the disk and saving tasks to the disk. The Storage class contains
* a TaskList object as its attribute. This class has two methods: load() and save().
* This method loads the existing tasks from disk into the TaskList object.
* This method loads the tasks from the TaskList object into the disk.
* The Task class represents the task the user inputs into the Duke program.
* Its attributes contain a boolean value, which tracks whether the task has been completed.
* And a String object, which contains the description of the task.
* The getStatusIcon returns a string that contains the icon depending on the value of the "isDone" attribute.
* @return String the icon representing the "isDone" boolean value
* The markAsDone method changes the boolean value of the "isDone" attribute to True.
* The TaskList class contains the list of tasks. It has methods: addTask, deleteTask, size() and get.
* Adds the task to the list.
* @param t The task being added to the list
* Delete task at index in the list.
* @param index the position of the task needed to be deleted
* returns the size of the list.
* returns the task at position index.
* @param index the position of the desired task
* The Ui class handles most of the interaction with the user.
* It contains methods: printList, markAsDone, printTask, printDeletedTask and printBye.
* This method prints out all the tasks on the list.
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list!");
* This method prints out a confirmation text that the task at position index has been marked as done.
* @param index the position of the task being marked done
System.out.println("Good job! I have marked the task as done! meow~ \n");
* This method prints out a confirmation text that task t has been added to the list.
System.out.println("Got it! I have added this task: \n");
System.out.println("Now you have " + this.taskList.size() + " tasks in the list! [^._.^]ﾉ");
* This method prints out a confirmation text that task t has been deleted from the list.
* @param t the task required to be deleted
System.out.println("Noted! I have removed this task: \n");
System.out.println("Now you have " + this.taskList.size() + " tasks in the list![^._.^]ﾉ");
* This method prints the bye statement.
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
DeadLine deadline = new DeadLine("return library books", LocalDateTime.parse("2019-02-05T20:00"));
Assertions.assertEquals("[D][" + "\u2718" + "]"+  " return library books (by: Feb 5 2019, 8:00 pm)", deadline.toString());
DeadLine deadline = new DeadLine("return library books", LocalDateTime.parse("2019-02-05T20:00"));
